No expression data available for pathway-based prediction. Relying on HRD-based PARP gates (see PARP_GERMLINE/PARP_HRD_RESCUE gates).

broken_pathways.description: Base Excision Repair is NON-FUNCTIONAL due to MBD4 mutations
Cell Cycle Checkpoint is COMPROMISED by TP53 mutations
UNKNOWN has minor disruption from PDGFRA

essential_pathways.description: Cancer depends on Homologous Recombination due to Base Excision Repair loss. Targetable with: Olaparib, Niraparib.
Cancer depends on PARP-mediated Repair due to Base Excision Repair loss. Targetable with: Olaparib, Niraparib.
Cancer depends on ATR/CHK1 Pathway due to Cell Cycle Checkpoint loss. Targetable with: Ceralasertib, Berzosertib. DepMap lineage grounding (Ovary/Fallopian Tube): +0.15 confidence boost.
Cancer depends on WEE1 Checkpoint due to Cell Cycle Checkpoint loss. Targetable with: Adavosertib. DepMap lineage grounding (Ovary/Fallopian Tube): +0.15 confidence boost.

essentiality_scores.functional_consequence: Frameshift â†’ premature stop codon â†’ loss of function

flags.message: Evo2 delta magnitudes are tiny (max=0.026335); treat as diagnostic only, not causal for SL triggers.

rationale: ATR inhibition â†’ replication stress â†’ cell death

recommended_drugs.mechanism: WEE1 inhibition â†’ G2/M checkpoint abrogation
rationale: WEE1 inhibition â†’ G2/M checkpoint abrogation

tests_needed.why: Required to determine if the tumor has Homologous Recombination Deficiency (HRD), a key biomarker for PARP inhibitors.
Tumor Mutational Burden (TMB) predicts response to checkpoint inhibitors (Keytruda, etc).
needed to measure actual pathway activity (e.g. VEGF, MAPK) beyond just DNA mutations.
Baseline CA-125 is critical for tracking response dynamics.
